page.title: 13CILFFRIW,A WELSH VILLAGE - 1
page.content: I have spelt the name of my village in the Welsh way,but some people may use the{English version}which is {Cilfrew.}It is an old village and most of the people who live in my part of the village have always lived there. Some of them can remember the time when there was{industry and plenty of {work}near Cilffriw,but today there is nothing like this. Everyone has to travel to{other places in search of {work. } There are six main streets,some of the older streets,such as New Road and Rosser Terrace,consist of{old terraced {houses}which date back to the earliest time of the village-about{150 years- } but there are also two new estates. One is a large council estate and the other is a small private one.
